BootGrdWrn.label: Enable Boot Guard warning message at build time

PTTWrn.label: Enable Intel (R) Platform Trust Technology warning message at build time

IfwiBuildVersion.help_text: 32-bit value to use as the IFWI build version number

IfwiRedundancyEnabled.label: Redundancy Enabled
IfwiRedundancyEnabled.help_text: Enable Redundancy support for critical layout components

DataRestoreStatus.label: Factory Defaults Restoration Status
DataRestoreStatus.help_text: Enable data restore to manufacturing defaults

DescSigningKey.label: Descriptor Debug Signing Key
DescSigningKey.help_text: This is the path to the private debug key used to sign the Descriptor, while public key hash of it is included in the OEM hash manifest. This setting is operative only when Flash Descriptor Verification is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/FdvEnabled).

OemBinary.label: OEM Section Binary
OemBinary.help_text: This loads the OEM Section binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: BIOS Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the BIOS binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Ifwi_IntelMePmcRegion.label: Ifwi: Intel(R) Me and Pmc Region

MeRegionFile.label: Intel(R) ME Binary File
MeRegionFile.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) ME binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

ChipInitBinary.label: Chipset Initialization Binary
ChipInitBinary.help_text: This loads the Chipset Initialization binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

PmcBinary.label: PMC Binary File
PmcBinary.help_text: This loads the PMC binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

ResizeNftpForFtpr.label: Enables NFTP resize for FTPR loading
ResizeNftpForFtpr.help_text: Used to enable NFTP resize for FTPR loading to perform FWU process. Disable for SKU's and platforms with limited image size, without FWU support only.

InputFile.label: EC Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Embedded Controller binary used for eSPI that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: EC Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Embedded Controller Data Region.

EcRegionPointer.label: EC Region Pointer File
EcRegionPointer.help_text: This loads a binary containing the 16 byte value to be written in the Embedded Controller Pointer region.

InputFile.label: GbE Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) Integrated LAN binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: GbE Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Gigabit Ethernet Region.

InputFile.label: IUnit Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the IUnit binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PCH Configuration File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the PCH Configuration binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: GBST Configuration File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the GBST Configuration binary that will be merged into the output image generated by Intel(R) FIT tool.

InputFile.label: PDR Binary File
InputFile.help_text: This loads the Platform Data region binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel (R) FIT tool.

Enabled.label: PDR Region Enable
Enabled.help_text: This option allows the user to enable or disable the Platform Data Region.

NumberOfComponents.label: Number of Flash Components
NumberOfComponents.help_text: Specifies the number of Flash components that will be installed on the target machine if using SPI.

FlashComponent1Size.label: Flash component 1 Size
FlashComponent1Size.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 1st Flash component.

FlashComponent2Size.label: Flash component 2 Size
FlashComponent2Size.help_text: This field identifies the size of the 2nd Flash component.

SpiGblProtRng.label: SPI Global Protected Range
SpiGblProtRng.help_text: Sets the default value of the Global Protected Range register in the SPI Flash Controller.

SpiIdlDpdwntimeout.label: SPI Idle to Deep Power Down Timeout
SpiIdlDpdwntimeout.help_text: SPI Idle to Deep Power Down Timeout Default Specifies the time in microseconds that the Flash Controller waits after all activity is idle before commanding the flash devices to Deep Power down, time = 2^N microseconds.

SpiOooEnable.label: SPI Out of Order operation Enabled
SpiOooEnable.help_text: When this setting is enabled priority operations may be issued while waiting for write / erase operations to complete on the flash device. When this setting is disabled all write / erase type operations in order.

SpiResHldDelay.label: SPI Resume Hold-off Delay
SpiResHldDelay.help_text: Specifies the time after the completion of a pri_op before the flash controller sends the resume instruction. If a new pri_op is eligible to be issued prior to the end of this delay time then the pri_op is issued and the timer is reinitialized to tRHD. 3-bit field encodes count with range 0-7. tRHD = count * 2us.

SpiMxWrErResSusInt.label: SPI Max write / erase Resume to Suspend intervals
SpiMxWrErResSusInt.help_text: This setting specifies the maximum value for the write and erase Resume to Suspend intervals.

SpiSusResEn.label: SPI Suspend / Resume Enabled
SpiSusResEn.help_text: When this setting is enabled writes and erases may be suspended to allow a read to be issued on the flash device. When this setting is disabled no transaction will be allowed to the busy flash device.

SoftReBindEnable.label: Software Re-Binding Enabled
SoftReBindEnable.help_text: When enabled this settings will allow for SPI re-binding to a new PCH during manufacturing and remanufacturing flows prior to platform EOM. Note: Re-binding to a replacement PCH can only be done a maximum of 5 times before the SPI part needs to be re-flashed.

HostCpuWriteAccessIntelRecommended.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access Intel Recommended
HostCpuWriteAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the Tiger Lake SPI Programming Guide.

HostCpuWriteAccessCustom.label: Host CPU / BIOS Write Access Custom
HostCpuWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

HostCpuReadAccessIntelRecommended.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access Intel Recommended
HostCpuReadAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the Tiger Lake SPI Programming Guide.

HostCpuReadAccessCustom.label: Host CPU / BIOS Read Access Custom
HostCpuReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Host CPU / BIOS. For further details on Region Access Control see the SPI and SMIP Programming Guide

MeWriteAccessIntelRecommended.label: Intel(R) ME Write Access Intel Recommended
MeWriteAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the ME region. For further details on Region Access Control see Ice Lake SPI Programming guide further details.

MeWriteAccessCustom.label: Intel(R) ME Write Access Custom
MeWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the ME region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

MeReadAccessIntelRecommended.label: Intel(R) ME Read Access Intel Recommended
MeReadAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the ME region. For further details on Region Access Control see Ice Lake SPI Programming guide further details.

MeReadAccessCustom.label: Intel(R) ME Read Access Custom
MeReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the ME region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

GbeWriteAccessIntelRecommended.label: GbE Write Access Intel Recommended
GbeWriteAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the GBE region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

GbeWriteAccessCustom.label: GbE Write Access Custom
GbeWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the GBE region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

GbeReadAccessIntelRecommended.label: GbE Read Access Intel Recommended
GbeReadAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the GBE region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

GbeReadAccessCustom.label: GbE Read Access Custom
GbeReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the GBE region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

EcReadAccessIntelRecommended.label: Embedded Controller Read Access Intel Recommended
EcReadAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Embedded Controller region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

EcReadAccessCustom.label: Embedded Controller Read Access Custom
EcReadAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines read access control for the Embedded Controller region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

EcWriteAccessIntelRecommended.label: Embedded Controller Write Access Intel Recommended
EcWriteAccessIntelRecommended.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Embedded Controller region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

EcWriteAccessCustom.label: Embedded Controller Write Access Custom
EcWriteAccessCustom.help_text: This setting determines write access control for the Embedded Controller region. For further details on Region Access Control see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide further details.

SpiDualIoReadEnable.label: Dual I/O Read Enable
SpiDualIoReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Dual I/O Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

SpiDualOutReadEnable.label: Dual Output Read Enable
SpiDualOutReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Dual Output Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP. If parameter table is not detected via the SFDP, this bit has no effect and Dual Output Read is controlled via the Flash Descriptor Component Section.Dual Output Fast Read Support bit.

FastReadClockFreq.label: Fast Read Clock Frequency
FastReadClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Fast Read. See SPI Programming guide further details.

FastReadSupport.label: Fast Read Supported
FastReadSupport.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable support for Fast Read capabilities for flash components. See SPI and SMIP Programming guide further details. Note: This setting needs to be enabled when using Dual / Quad enabled components.

InvalidInstruction0.label: Invalid Instruction 0
InvalidInstruction0.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction1.label: Invalid Instruction 1
InvalidInstruction1.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction2.label: Invalid Instruction 2
InvalidInstruction2.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction3.label: Invalid Instruction 3
InvalidInstruction3.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction4.label: Invalid Instruction 4
InvalidInstruction4.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction5.label: Invalid Instruction 5
InvalidInstruction5.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction6.label: Invalid Instruction 6
InvalidInstruction6.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

InvalidInstruction7.label: Invalid Instruction 7
InvalidInstruction7.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure invalid instruction to protect against Chip Erase. Note: This setting should be set to '0' if there are not Invalid instructions.

QuadIoReadEnable.label: Quad I/O Read Enable
QuadIoReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Quad I/O Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

QuadOutReadEnable.label: Quad Output Read Enable
QuadOutReadEnable.help_text: This soft-strap only has effect if Quad Output Read is discovered as supported via the SFDP.

ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.label: Read ID and Read Status Clock Frequency
ReadIdAndReadStatClkFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Read ID and Read Status. See SPI Programming guide further details.

WriteEraseClockFreq.label: Write and Erase Clock Frequency
WriteEraseClockFreq.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the flash component clock frequency setting for Write and Erase. See SPI Programming guide further details.

VsccEntryName.label: Part Name
VsccEntryName.help_text: This setting allow the OEM input a name designation for each flash component being used. Note: This is a free form entry field it does not affect actual flash component operation.

VsccEntryVendorId.label: Vendor ID
VsccEntryVendorId.help_text: This configures the JEDEC vendor specific byte ID of the SPI flash Component see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryDeviceId0.label: Device ID 0
VsccEntryDeviceId0.help_text: This configures the JEDEC device specific byte ID 0 of the SPI flash Component see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

VsccEntryDeviceId1.label: Device ID 1
VsccEntryDeviceId1.help_text: This configures the JEDEC device specific byte ID 1 of the SPI flash Component see Canonlake H / LP SPI Programming guide for further details.

BiosRedAssistance.label: BIOS Redundancy Assistance
BiosRedAssistance.help_text: In case of BIOS boot failure, CSME will configure the platform to boot with backup BIOS using Top Swap. Note: This option is only available when Boot Guard is enabled.

TopSwapOverride.label: Top Swap Block Size
TopSwapOverride.help_text: This configures the Top Swap Block size for the platform. For further details see Tiger Lake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

BiosBootSelect.label: BIOS Boot Select
BiosBootSelect.help_text: This setting determines if BIOS will be booted from LPC or SPI.

HwBindingEn.label: Hardware Binding Enabled
HwBindingEn.help_text: This setting configures the FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior for the platform image. If this setting is enabled FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior will occur when platform close manufacturing flow is executed with Intel® FPT. If this setting is disabled FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior will not take place when close manufacturing flow is executed. Note: For Revenue parts this setting will be ignored and FPF Hardware and RPMC / RPMB binding behavior will take place when close manufacturing flow is executed.

RpmcSupported.label: RPMC Supported
RpmcSupported.help_text: This setting determines if RPMC is enabled. Note: The SPI parts being used need to support RPMC In order to use this feature.

RpmcRebindEn.label: RPMC Rebinding Enabled
RpmcRebindEn.help_text: This setting determines if Rebinding of RPMC enabled SPI parts is enabled.

ProcEmulation.value_list: No Emulation,,EMULATE Intel (R) vPro (TM) capable Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Core (TM) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Celeron (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Pentium (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Xeon E (R) branded Processor,,EMULATE Intel (R) Xeon W (R) Manageability capable Processor
ProcEmulation.label: Processor Emulation

FwUpdateOemId.label: Firmware Update OEM ID
FwUpdateOemId.help_text: This setting allows configuration of an OEM unique ID to ensure that customers can only update their platform with images from the OEM of the platform.

HideMEBxFwUpdCtrl.label: Hide MEBx Firmware Update Control
HideMEBxFwUpdCtrl.help_text: This setting allows customers to hide the Firmware Update option in the MEBx interface.

HmrfpoEnable.label: Intel(R) ME Region Flash Protection Override
HmrfpoEnable.help_text: This setting enables descriptor unlock of the ME Region when the HMRFPO message is sent to firmware prior to BIOS End of POST.

FwAutoBist.label: Automatic Built in Self Test
FwAutoBist.help_text: This setting enables the firmware Automatic Built in Self Test which is executed during first platform boot after initial image flashing.

EomFirstBootEnabled.label: EOM on First Boot Enabled
EomFirstBootEnabled.help_text: This setting detremines if End of Manufacturing will be triggered on first boot of the platform after flashing. Note: When this setting is enabled Intel(R) CSME will enter End of Manufacturing regardless of the descriptor settings.

FlexibleEomSettings.value_list: Lock Descriptor and OEM Configs,,Lock OEM Configs Only,,Lock Descriptor Only,,Do not lock Descriptor and OEM Configs
FlexibleEomSettings.label: Flexible EOM setting options
FlexibleEomSettings.help_text: This setting deteremines which settings will be automatically commited during End of Manufacturing flows. Note: The FPFs, RPMB / RPMC and set manufacturing mode settings are mandatory and cannot be overridden revenue parts. Simulation can be done on non-revenue part with the Hardware binding set to disabled.

MctpStackConfig.label: MCTP Stack Configuration
MctpStackConfig.help_text: Defines the ME's 8-bits MCTP Endpoint IDs for each SMBus physical interface (SMBus, SMLink0 and SMLink1). These values are needed for FW to communicate with MCTP end points. For each of these 3 bytes, a value of 0x00 means not used, and values 0xFF or 0x01 - 0x07 or 0x20 - 0x2F are not allowed.

PrtcBackupPower.label: Persistent PRTC Backup Power
PrtcBackupPower.help_text: FPF that indicates if the device is designed such that it may lose PRTC power more than 10 times throughout the normal lifecycle of the product and hence has no persistent time or AR protection. At EOM, this value is burned to an FPF, and can never be changed.

MeMeasuredBootState.label: Intel(R) ME Measured Boot State
MeMeasuredBootState.help_text: When measured boot is enabled firmware will use additional extended registers for all IUPs and Key Manifests that firmware loads and verifies from flash. Note: When measured boot is enabled any IUPs or firmware updates will require a global reset

MeBiosBootAssist.label: Intel(R) ME Assisted BIOS Boot
MeBiosBootAssist.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) ME Assisted BIOS Boot capabilities.

AmtSupported.label: Intel(R) AMT Supported
AmtSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to disable Intel(R) AMT on the platform and force the platform into Standard Manageability mode. Note: This setting is only applies to Desktop and Workstation platforms.

MngHwStatus.label: Manageability Application Hardware Status
MngHwStatus.help_text: This setting will permanently disable Manageability hardware through platform FPFs. At End-of-Manufacturing (EOM), enable/disable policy value is committed to FPF and can never be changed. Permanently disabling Manageability HW via this setting requires “Manageability Application Supported” is set to permanently disabled and “Intel® ME Network Services Supported” is set to disabled. Note: When “Manageability Application Hardware Status” is Enabled but “Manageability Application Supported” is set to permanently disabled and “Intel® ME Network Services Supported” is set to disabled, Manageability HW is disabled by a soft strap.

NetServicesSupported.label: Intel(R) ME Network Services Supported
NetServicesSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Intel(R) ME Network Services on the platform. Note: If this setting is disabled Intel(R) AMT will also be disabled.

MngAppSupported.label: Manageability Application Supported
MngAppSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to permenantly disable Intel(R) AMT and Standard Manageability mode on the platform.

MngAppPowerUpState.label: Manageability Application initial power-up state
MngAppPowerUpState.help_text: This setting allows customers to determine the power up state for Intel(R) AMT or Standard Manageability. Note: If this setting is disabled Intel(R) AMT or Standard Manageability can still be re-enabled through the MEBx interface.

AmtIdleTimeout.label: Intel(R) AMT Idle Timeout
AmtIdleTimeout.help_text: This setting configures the idle timeout value before Intel(R) AMT enters into an off state.

AmtWdAutoReset.label: Intel(R) AMT Watchdog Automatic Reset Enabled
AmtWdAutoReset.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable the Intel (R) ME firmware to trigger an automatic platform reset if either the MEI or Agent Presence are in a hung state. Note: This feature only allows one reset at a time when the watchdog expires. After this feature has triggered a reset it must be re-armed for re-use via management console.

KvmScreenBlnkEnable.label: Firmware KVM Screen Blanking
KvmScreenBlnkEnable.help_text: This setting enables KVM Screen blanking capabilities in the firmware image. Note: This feature is dependent on processor level support.

KvmSupported.label: KVM Redirection Supported
KvmSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable the KVM Redirection capabilities of the firmware. Note: If this setting have been set to disabled it cannot be re-enabled once the descriptor has been locked.

EhbcEnable.label: Embedded Host Based Configuration Enabled
EhbcEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Embedded Host Based Configuration. EHBC is primarily intended for use in embedded systems, please leave this setting disabled for business client systems.

PkiDomainSuffix.label: PKI Domain Name Suffix
PkiDomainSuffix.help_text: This setting allows OEMs to pre-configure the Domain Name Suffix used for PKI provisioning in their firmware image. Note: For normal out-of- box provisioning functionality this setting should be left empty.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 1.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 1. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 1. If enabled the certificate will be used in addition those already preloaded in base firmware during provisioning. Note: If the platform is un-configured the Custom Certificate Hash will be deleted.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 2.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 2. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 2. If enabled the certificate will be used in addition those already preloaded in base firmware during provisioning. Note: If the platform is un-configured the Custom Certificate Hash will be deleted.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 3.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 3. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning Custom Certificate 3. If enabled the certificate will be used in addition those already preloaded in base firmware during provisioning. Note: If the platform is un-configured the Custom Certificate Hash will be deleted.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 1.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 1. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 1. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 2.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 2. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 2. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 3.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 3. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 3. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 4.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 4. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 4. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

CertActive.label: Certificate Enabled
CertActive.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable PKI provisioning Default certificate 5.

CertFriendly.label: Certificate Friendly Name
CertFriendly.help_text: This setting allows customers to assign a user friendly name for PKI provisioning Default Certificate 5. Maximum of 32 characters.

CertStream.label: Certificate Stream
CertStream.help_text: This setting allows customers to input hash stream for PKI provisioning custom certificate 5. Note: Default Certificates if enabled will be used in addition those already preloaded in firmware during provisioning. Unlike Customizable Certificates the Default Certificates are not deleted when the platform is un-provisioned.

RedirectionLanguage.label: Redirection Localized Language
RedirectionLanguage.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure which localized language will be used initially by firmware for user consent output information (Examples: may be displayed before SOL / KVM session starts).

RedirectionPrivSecLevel.label: Redirection Privacy / Security Level
RedirectionPrivSecLevel.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the Privacy and Security level for redirection operations. Default enables all redirection ports (User consent is configurable). Enhanced enables all redirection ports (User consent is required and cannot be disabled). Extreme disables all redirection capabilities.

TlsCryptoSupport.label: Transport Layer Security crypto support
TlsCryptoSupport.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable/ disable FW Transport Layer Security algorithm crypto fuse. Note: if this is disabled, TLS is still operational but without crypto.

PavpSupported.label: PAVP Supported
PavpSupported.help_text: This setting determines if the Protected Audio Video Path (PAVP) feature will be permanently disabled in the FW image.

Hdcp5kedisp1.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 1 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp1.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 1. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

Hdcp5kedisp2.label: HDCP Internal Display Port 2 - 5K
Hdcp5kedisp2.help_text: This setting determines which port is connected for 5K output on Internal Display 2. Note: Both Display 1 & 2 need to be configured for proper operation.

GucHash.label: GuC Encryption Key
GucHash.help_text: This option is for entering the raw hash 256 bit string for the Graphics uController.

PlatformIntegrity.label: Hash Key Configuration for Bootguard / ISH

OemPublicKeyHash.label: OEM Public Key Hash
OemPublicKeyHash.help_text: Raw hash string for the SHA-384 hash of the OEM public key corresponding to the private key used to sign the OEM Key hash manifest. When manufacture is completed, this hash value is burned into an FPF, and is permament. This value is used to verify the OEM Key hash, and also DnX images. OEM signing is disabled when this hash is set to all 0s.

OemExtInputFile.label: OEM Key Manifest Binary
OemExtInputFile.help_text: Signed manifest file containing hashes of keys used for signing components of image. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

OemKeyRevEnable.label: Oem Key Revocation Enable
OemKeyRevEnable.help_text: Enabling the OEM key revocation mechanism requires 'OEM Public Key Hash' and 'Second OEM key hash' to be configured.

SkipOemKeysCheck.label: Skip OEM Keys Check
SkipOemKeysCheck.help_text: This is meant for debugging purposes only. Enabling this parameter impacts image creation procedure in FIT tool only.

excludeMasterAccsess.label: exclude master access in the signature
excludeMasterAccsess.help_text: include/exclude master access in the signature.

Range1Offset.label: Range 1 offset
Range1Offset.help_text: Range 1 offset covers manifest, cannot be changed

Range1Size.label: Range 1 size
Range1Size.help_text: Range 1 size covers manifest, cannot be changed

Range2Offset.label: Range 2 offset
Range2Offset.help_text: Range 2 offset covers master accsess ofsset

Range2Size.label: Range 2 size
Range2Size.help_text: Range 2 size covers master accsess size

Range3Offset.label: Range 3 offset
Range3Offset.help_text: Range 3 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range3Size.label: Range 3 size
Range3Size.help_text: Range 3 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range4Offset.label: Range 4 offset
Range4Offset.help_text: Range 4 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range4Size.label: Range 4 size
Range4Size.help_text: Range 4 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range5Offset.label: Range 5 offset
Range5Offset.help_text: Range 5 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range5Size.label: Range 5 size
Range5Size.help_text: Range 5 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range6Offset.label: Range 6 offset
Range6Offset.help_text: Range 6 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range6Size.label: Range 6 size
Range6Size.help_text: Range 6 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range7Offset.label: Range 7 offset
Range7Offset.help_text: Range 7 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range7Size.label: Range 7 size
Range7Size.help_text: Range 7 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

Range8Offset.label: Range 8 offset
Range8Offset.help_text: Range 8 offset covers OEM defined unprotected range start

Range8Size.label: Range 8 size
Range8Size.help_text: Range 8 size covers OEM defined unprotected range length

BtGuardKeyManifestId.label: Key Manifest ID
BtGuardKeyManifestId.help_text: ODM identifier used during the Key manifest authentication process. This setting is only configurable, and must be non-0, when OEM Public Key Hash is set (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardProfileConfig.value_list: Boot Guard Profile 0 - No_FVME,,Boot Guard Profile 3 - VM,,Boot Guard Profile 4 - FVE,,Boot Guard Profile 5 - FVME
BtGuardProfileConfig.label: Boot Guard Profile Configuration
BtGuardProfileConfig.help_text: Boot Guard Profile 0 - Legacy is for platforms that do not wish to enable Boot Guard boot block verification or measurement protection. When manufacture is completed, this value is burned into an FPF, and is permanent. This setting is only configurable when OEM signing is enabled (See PlatformIntegrity/OemPublicKeyHash).

BtGuardCpuDebugEnable.label: CPU Debugging
BtGuardCpuDebugEnable.help_text: This setting determines if CPU debug modes will be displayed. When set to 'Yes' CPU debugging is enabled.

BtGuardBspInitEnable.label: BSP Initialization
BtGuardBspInitEnable.help_text: This setting determines BSP behavior when it receives an INIT signal. When set to 'Yes', when BSP receives an INIT, BSP will signal an error to the BSS register and enter unrecoverable shutdown.

IomArbEnable.label: IO Manageability Engine Manifest Anti-Rollback Enabled
IomArbEnable.help_text: This setting enables Anti-Roll back for the Type-C Subsystem IO Manageability Engine binary.

NphyPhyArbEnable.label: NPHY Manifest Anti-Rollback Enabled
NphyPhyArbEnable.help_text: This setting enables Anti-Roll back for the Type-C Subsystem NPHY binary.

TbtArbEnable.label: Thunderbolt(TM) Manifest Anti-Rollback Enabled
TbtArbEnable.help_text: This setting enables Anti-Roll back for the Type-C Subsystem Thunderbolt(TM) binary.

PttSupported.label: Intel(R) PTT Supported
PttSupported.help_text: This setting permanently disables Intel(R) PTT in the firmware image.

PttSupportedFpf.label: Intel(R) PTT Supported [FPF]
PttSupportedFpf.help_text: This setting will permanently disable Intel(R) PTT through platform FPFs. Caution: Using this option will permanently disable Intel(R) PTT on the platform hardware.

SpiOverTpmClkFreq.label: TPM Clock Frequency
SpiOverTpmClkFreq.help_text: This setting determines the clock frequency setting to be used for the TPM over SPI bus.

SpiOverTpmBusEnable.label: TPM Over SPI Bus Enabled
SpiOverTpmBusEnable.help_text: This setting determines the clock frequency setting to be used for the TPM over SPI bus.

BiosGrdProtOvrdEn.label: BIOS Guard Protection Override Enabled
BiosGrdProtOvrdEn.help_text: This setting allows BIOS Guard to bypass SPI flash controller protections (i.e. Protected Range Registers and Top Swap).

TxtSupported.label: TXT Supported
TxtSupported.help_text: This setting determines is enabled for the platform.

CryptoHwSupport.label: Crypto HW Support
CryptoHwSupport.help_text: This setting can be used to disable crypto funtionality. This settings disables all crypto dependent features.

EnableTDS.label: Enable TDS Capabilities
EnableTDS.help_text: This setting enables Intel(R) Trusted Device Setup on the platform

FuSaPrfTstRepI2CIntrfc.label: FuSa Proof Tests Reporting I2C Interface
FuSaPrfTstRepI2CIntrfc.help_text: This setting determines which SMBus interface will be used for FuSa Proof Tests Reporting I2C interface.

FuSaPrfTstMcuI2CAddrs.label: FuSa Proof Tests MCU I2C Address
FuSaPrfTstMcuI2CAddrs.help_text: This setting configures the FuSa Proof Tests I2C MCU address for the platform.

FuSaPrfTestComponents.label: FuSa Proof Test Components
FuSaPrfTestComponents.help_text: This setting determines which FuSa tests will be run based on the mask value input. Note: See Firmware Bring-up Guide for valid values.

FailsafeBootProfile.label: Failsafe Boot Profile
FailsafeBootProfile.help_text: Boot profile used when system instability is detected.

ProfileChangeable.label: Profile Changeable
ProfileChangeable.help_text: True = Allows user to change boot profile via BIOS menu or 3rd party application False = Prevents user from changing boot profile via BIOS or 3rd party application. Note: When false, Failsafe Boot Profile must be the same as Boot Profile.

IsBclkConfValid.label: BCLK Build-time Clock Configuration Enabled
IsBclkConfValid.help_text: Enables/disables BCLK Build-time Clock configuration values for adaptive profiles.

BclkFreq.label: BCLK Clock Frequency
BclkFreq.help_text: Displays the nominal frequency for the selected clock.

BclkSsc.label: BCLK Spread setting
BclkSsc.help_text: Displays the percentage of Spread setting for the selected clock.

ProfileName.label: Profile Name
ProfileName.help_text: Editable text string stored with the profile for easy identification.

ProfileType.label: Profile Type
ProfileType.help_text: Specifies the profile template used when creating the profile. Intel (R) ME image has to be loaded to enable other ICC profile settings.

BClkSscHalt.label: BCLK SSC Halt Allowed
BClkSscHalt.help_text: If set to Yes, the spread generator can be enabled and disabled at runtime.

ClkoutSRC0.label: SRC0
ClkoutSRC0.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC0 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC1.label: SRC1
ClkoutSRC1.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC1 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC2.label: SRC2
ClkoutSRC2.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC2 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC3.label: SRC3
ClkoutSRC3.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC3 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC4.label: SRC4
ClkoutSRC4.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC4 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC5.label: SRC5
ClkoutSRC5.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC5 differential output buffer.

ClkoutSRC6.label: SRC6
ClkoutSRC6.help_text: Enable/Disable the CLKOUT_SRC6 differential output buffer.

ClkreqMapSRC0.label: SRC0 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC0.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC0. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC1.label: SRC1 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC1.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC1. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC2.label: SRC2 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC2.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC2. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC3.label: SRC3 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC3.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC3. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC4.label: SRC4 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC4.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC4. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC5.label: SRC5 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC5.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC5. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

ClkreqMapSRC6.label: SRC6 CLKREQ# Mapping
ClkreqMapSRC6.help_text: Assign the CLKREQ# signal associated with CLKOUT_SRC6. Please note that remapping of any SRC CLKREQ# would require swapping the relevant status of SRC# under Clock Output Configuration to match the remapping.

vproNicEnabled.label: Platform vPro 2.5G Wired LAN Enabled
vproNicEnabled.help_text: YES = Discrete NIC enabled in platform NO = Integrated GBE LAN enabled in platform

vproNicSMBusAddress.label: Platform vPro 2.5G Wired LAN SMBUS slave address
vproNicSMBusAddress.help_text: Platform discrete NIC slave address Note: Input needs to be in HEX format(OEM specific), e.g. 0x12

DockingStation.label: Intel vPro (TM) for Thunderbolt (TM) 3/ USB-C Dock station

vproDockEnabled.label: vPro Dock Enabled
vproDockEnabled.help_text: YES = Enables communication with, vPro supporting NIC, via TBT dock NO = No support for vPro dock solution

TypeCPortRetimerMCTPSmbusAddr.label: vPro 2.5G Wired LAN on dock slave SMBUS Address
TypeCPortRetimerMCTPSmbusAddr.help_text: Dock NIC slave address Note: Input needs to be in HEX format(OEM specific), e.g. 0x12

TypeCPort1RetimerI2cAddress.label: Thunderbolt Port1 SMBus Address
TypeCPort1RetimerI2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: Input needs to be in HEX format(OEM specific), e.g. 0x12

TypeCPort2RetimerI2cAddress.label: Thunderbolt Port2 SMBus Address
TypeCPort2RetimerI2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: Input needs to be in HEX format(OEM specific), e.g. 0x12

TypeCPort3RetimerI2cAddress.label: Thunderbolt Port3 SMBus Address
TypeCPort3RetimerI2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: Input needs to be in HEX format(OEM specific), e.g. 0x12

TypeCPort4RetimerI2cAddress.label: Thunderbolt Port4 SMBus Address
TypeCPort4RetimerI2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: Input needs to be in HEX format(OEM specific), e.g. 0x12

MELanPowerWell.label: LAN Power Well
MELanPowerWell.help_text: This setting allows the customer to configure the powerwell that will be used by Intel(R) Integrated LAN. Note: Recommended setting is SLP_LAN#.

LanPhyPwrUpTime.label: LAN PHY Power Up Time
LanPhyPwrUpTime.help_text: This bit determines how long the delay for LAN PHY to power up after de-assertion of SLP_LAN#

LanEnable.label: Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN Enabled
LanEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Intel(R) Integrated LAN operation over the PCIe Port selected by the GbE PCIe Port Select option.

GbePCIePortSelect.label: GbE PCIe Port Select
GbePCIePortSelect.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the PCIe Port that will Intel(R) Integrated LAN will operate on.

GbePHYSmbAddrs.label: GbE PHY SMBus Address
GbePHYSmbAddrs.help_text: This is the Intel PHY SMBus address. This field must be programmed to 64h. GbE PHY SMBus Address and GbE MAC address have to be programmed to 64h and 70h in order to ensure proper arbitration of SMBus communication between the Intel integrated MAC and PHY.

GbeMacSmbAddrsEn.label: GbE MAC SMBus Address Enabled
GbeMacSmbAddrsEn.help_text: This enables the Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN MAC SMBus address. Note: This setting must be enabled if using Intel(R) Integrated LAN.

GbeMacSmbAddrs.label: GbE MAC SMBus Address
GbeMacSmbAddrs.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) Integrated Wired LAN MAC SMBus address to accept SMBus cycles from the PHY. Note: Recommended setting is 70h.

PhyConnected.value_list: No PHY Connected,,PHY on SMBus,,PHY on SMLink0,,PHY on SMLink1
PhyConnected.label: PHY Connection
PhyConnected.help_text: This selects which SMBus network is used to connect GbE PHY to MAC/PCH.

LanPhyPwrCtrlGpd11Config.label: LAN PHY Power Control GPD11 Signal Configuration
LanPhyPwrCtrlGpd11Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the LAN PHY Power Control signal to GbE or as GDP11. Note: If using Intel(R) Integrated LAN this setting should be set to ""Enable as LANPHYPC"".

MeClinkEnable.label: Intel(R) ME CLINK Signal Enabled
MeClinkEnable.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable the Wireless LAN CLINK signal through Intel(R) ME firmware. Note: For using Intel(R) vPro Wireless solutions this should be set to Yes.

WlanUcode.label: WLAN Microcode
WlanUcode.help_text: This setting allows OEMs to configure which Intel(R) Wireless LAN card microcode to load into the firmware image.

MEWlanPowerWell.value_list: Disabled,,Core Well || SLP_S3#,,Primary Well || SLP_SUS#,,ME Well || SLP_A#,,SLP_WLAN#
MEWlanPowerWell.label: WLAN Power Well

OnDieClinkEn.label: CNVi / On Die CLINK Enabled
OnDieClinkEn.help_text: This setting determines whether the internal CNVi / On-die CLINK port is enabled. Note: This setting should be enabled if the WLAN adapter on the platform is CNVi.

SlpWlanGdp9Config.label: SLP_WLAN# / GDP9 Signal Configuration
SlpWlanGdp9Config.help_text: This setting allows user the to assign the WLAN Power Control signal to WLAN or as GDP9. Note: If using Intel(R) Wireless LAN this setting should be set to ""Enable as SLP_WLAN#"".

TsnEnabled.label: Time Sensitive Networking
TsnEnabled.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable Time Sensitive Networking on the platform. Note: This feature is not applicable for ICP-N.

TsnGbePortSelect.label: TSN GbE Port Select
TsnGbePortSelect.help_text: This setting allows customers to configure the PCIe Port that will the TSN GbE will operate on. Note: The Intel(R ) Integrated LAN and TSN GbE are mutually exclusive only one of them can be configued.

t573TimingConfig.label: PCH clock output stable to PROCPWRGD high (tPCH45)
t573TimingConfig.help_text: This setting configures the minimum timing from XCK_PLL locked to CPUPWRGD high. For further details see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

t36TimerEnable.label: PCIe Power Stable Timer (tPCH33)
t36TimerEnable.help_text: This setting configures the enables / disables the tPCH33 timer. When enabled PCH will count 99ms from PWROK assertion before PLTRST# is de-asserted. Note: The recommended setting is ""Disabled""

t1001TimingConfig.label: PROCPWRGD and SYS_PWROK high to SUS_STAT# de-assertion (tPCH46)
t1001TimingConfig.help_text: This setting configures the minimum timing from CPUPWRGD assertion to SUS_STAT#. For further details see Tigerlake LP Controller Hub EDS.

ApwrokTiming.label: APWROK Timing
ApwrokTiming.help_text: This soft strap determines the timing between the SLP_A# pin de-asserting and the APWROK timer expiration.

OcWdtSsEnable.value_list: OC WDT Disabled,,OC WDT 3 Second Timeout,,OC WDT 5 Second Timeout,,OC WDT 10 Second Timeout,,OC WDT 15 Second Timeout,,OC WDT 30 Second Timeout,,OC WDT 45 Second Timeout,,OC WDT 60 Second Timeout
OcWdtSsEnable.label: Over Clocking Watchdog Self Start Enable
OcWdtSsEnable.help_text: This setting affect whether the Over Clocking Watchdog Timer is enabled to automatically start on Host power cycle.

SLink0MctpEnable.label: Intel(R) SMLink0 MCTP Address Enabled
SLink0MctpEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMLink0 MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes.

SLink0MctpAddress.label: Intel(R) SMLink0 MCTP Address
SLink0MctpAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMLink0 MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing.

SMBusAsdAddress.label: Intel(R) SMBus ASD Address
SMBusAsdAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus Alert Sending Device Address. For details see Tiger Lake LP SPI Programming guide further details.

SMBusAsdEnable.label: Intel(R) SMBus ASD Address Enabled
SMBusAsdEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus Alert Sending Device. For details see Tiger Lake LP SPI Programming guide further details.

SMBusAsfId.label: Intel(R) SMBus Subsystem Vendor and Device ID for ASF
SMBusAsfId.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus Subsystem Vendor and Device ID for ASF. For details see Tiger Lake LP SPI Programming guide further details.

SMBusI2cAddress.label: Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address
SMBusI2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is ""0000000""

SMBusI2cEnable.label: Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address Enabled
SMBusI2cEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus I2C Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is ""No""

SMBusMctpAddress.label: Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address
SMBusMctpAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The default setting is ""0000000""

SMBusMctpEnable.label: Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address Enabled
SMBusMctpEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is ""No""

SMBusTcoSlaveSelect.label: SMBus / SMLink TCO Slave Connection
SMBusTcoSlaveSelect.help_text: This setting configures the TCO Slave connection to ether the Intel(R) SMBus or SMLink0. For further details see Tiger Lake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink0Enable.label: SMLink0 Enabled
SLink0Enable.help_text: This setting enables / disables SMLink0 interface. For further details see Tiger Lake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: If using Intel(R) NFC this setting must be set to ""Yes"".

SLink0freq.label: SMLink0 Frequency
SLink0freq.help_text: This setting determines the frequency at which the SMLink0 will operate. Note: The recommended setting is ""1MHz""

SLink1I2cAddress.label: SMLink1 I2C Target Address
SLink1I2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures SMLink1 I2C Target Address. For further details see Tiger Lake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink1I2cEnable.label: SMLink1 I2C Target Address Enabled
SLink1I2cEnable.help_text: This setting configures SMLink1 I2C Target Address. For further details see Tiger Lake LP or Lewisburg Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink1GPTargetAddress.label: SMLink1 GP Target Address
SLink1GPTargetAddress.help_text: This setting configures SMLink1 GP Target Address. For further details see Tiger Lake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SLink1GPTargetEnable.label: SMLink1 GP Target Address Enabled
SLink1GPTargetEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables SMLink1 GP Target Address interface. For further details see Tiger Lake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting must be set to """"Yes"""" if using PCH / MCP Thermal reporting.

SLink1Enable.label: SMLink1 Enabled
SLink1Enable.help_text: This setting enables / disables SMLink1 interface. For further details see Tiger Lake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting must be set to "Yes" if using PCH / MCP Thermal reporting.

SLink1MctpAddress.label: SMLink1 MCTP Address
SLink1MctpAddress.help_text: This setting configures the Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The default setting is ""0000000""

SLink1MctpEnable.label: SMLink1 MCTP Address Enabled
SLink1MctpEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel(R) SMBus MCTP Address. Note: This setting is only used for testing purposes. The recommended setting is ""No""

SLink1freq.label: SMLink1 Frequency
SLink1freq.help_text: This setting determines the frequency at which the SMLink1 will operate. Note: The recommended setting is ""100KHz""

SmbAlrtModeConfig.value_list: Enable as GPP_C2,,Enable as Intel(R) SMBus ASD
SmbAlrtModeConfig.label: Intel(R) SMBus ASD Mode Configuration
SmbAlrtModeConfig.help_text: This setting determines the native mode of operation for the Intel(R) SMBus ASD signal.

SLink0I2cAddress.label: SMLink0 I2C Address
SLink0I2cAddress.help_text: This setting configures the SMLink0 I2C Address. Note: This setting is used as a part of the Intel(R) vPro Thunderbolt(tm) dock configuration.

SMLink0I2cEnable.label: SMLink0 I2C Address Enabled
SMLink0I2cEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the SMLink0 I2C Address. Note: This setting is used as a part of the Intel(R) vPro Thunderbolt(tm) dock configuration.

DmiLaneReversal.label: DMI Lane Reversal
DmiLaneReversal.help_text: This setting allow the DMI Lane signals to be reversed. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

DmiPciPortStagger.label: DMI Port Staggering Enabled
DmiPciPortStagger.help_text: This setting configures DMI for Port Staggering. For further details see Canonlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

OpiLinkSpeed.label: OPI / DMI Link Speed
OpiLinkSpeed.help_text: This setting configures the OPI Link Speed. For further details see Canonlake PCH EDS.

OpiLinkVoltage.label: OPI /DMI Link Voltage
OpiLinkVoltage.help_text: This setting configures the OPI Link Voltage. For further details see Canonlake PCH EDS.

OpiLinkWidth.label: OPI / DMI Link Width
OpiLinkWidth.help_text: This setting configures the OPI Link Width. For further details see Canonlake PCH EDS.

EspiEcBusfreq.label: eSPI / EC Bus Frequency
EspiEcBusfreq.help_text: Indicates the maximum frequency of the eSPI bus that is supported by the eSPI Master and platform configuration (trace length, number of Slaves, etc.). The actual frequency of the eSPI bus will be the minimum of this field and the Slave's maximum frequency advertised in its General Capabilities register.

EspiEcMaxIoMode.value_list: Single,,Single and Dual,,Single and Quad,,Single, Dual and Quad
EspiEcMaxIoMode.label: eSPI / EC Maximum I/O Mode
EspiEcMaxIoMode.help_text: Indicates the maximum IO Mode (Single/Dual/Quad) of the eSPI bus that is supported by the eSPI Master and specific platform configuration. The actual IO Mode of the eSPI bus will be the minimum of this field and the Slave's maximum IO Mode advertised in its General Capabilities register.

EspiEcCrcCheckEnable.label: eSPI / EC CRC Check Enabled
EspiEcCrcCheckEnable.help_text: This setting enables CRC checking on eSPI Slave 0 channel.

EspiEcMaxOutReqMstrFlCh.label: eSPI / EC Max Outstanding Request for Master Attached Flash Channel
EspiEcMaxOutReqMstrFlCh.help_text: This setting determines the Maximum outstanding requests on the eSPI / EC Master Attached Flash Channel.

EspiEcSlvAtchdFlshMor.label: eSPI / EC Slave Attached Flash Multiple Outstanding Requests Enable
EspiEcSlvAtchdFlshMor.help_text: This setting enabled multiple outstanding requests for the eSPI / EC Slave Attached Flash device.

EspiEcSlvAtchdFlshOoo.label: eSPI / EC Slave Attached Flash Channel OOO Enable
EspiEcSlvAtchdFlshOoo.help_text: This setting enables Out or Order requests on the eSPI / EC Slave Attached Flash device.

SlpS5Gdp10Config.label: SLP_S5# / GPD10 Signal Configuration
SlpS5Gdp10Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_S5# Power Control signal as SLP_S5# or as GDP10. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS3Gdp4Config.label: SLP_S3# / GPD4 Signal Configuration
SlpS3Gdp4Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_S3# Power Control signal as SLP_S3# or as GDP4. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS4Gdp5Config.label: SLP_S4# / GPD5 Signal Configuration
SlpS4Gdp5Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_S4# Power Control signal as SLP_S4# or as GDP5. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpAGpd6Config.label: SLP_A# / GPD6 Signal Configuration
SlpAGpd6Config.help_text: This setting allows the user to assign the SLP_A# Power Control signal as SLP_A# or as GDP6. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SlpS0TunnelDis.label: SLP_S0# Tunnel
SlpS0TunnelDis.help_text: This setting Enables / Disables the tunneling of the SLP_S0# pin over ESPI to the EC when in ESPI mode.

DeepSxSupportEnable.label: Deep Sx Enabled
DeepSxSupportEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables support for Deep Sx operation. For further details see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: Support for Deep Sx is board design dependent.

PchThrmlRprtngEn.label: Thermal Power Reporting Enabled
PchThrmlRprtngEn.help_text: This setting enabled a once-per-second timer interrupt is enabled which triggers firmware to report power and temperature information as enabled by configuration registers. Note: When this setting is disabled ensure that the once-per-second timer interrupt associated with this feature is also disabled.

IshSupported.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Supported
IshSupported.help_text: This setting allows customers to enable / disable ISH on the platform.

IshPowerUpState.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Initial Power State
IshPowerUpState.help_text: This setting allows customers to determine the power up state for ISH.

Length.label: Integrated Sensor Hub Length
Length.help_text: Total size (in bytes) of the ISH code partition including reserved space. It is recommended to be at least 256kb.

InputFile.label: ISH InputFile
InputFile.help_text: Path to your ISH firmware binary file.

PdtBinary.label: ISH PDT Binary File
PdtBinary.help_text: Path to your PDT binary file.

SecureTouch.label: Secure Touch
SecureTouch.help_text: When set, CAMERA_MASK register bits per CSI port are used to mask the data of cameras. When cleared, camera data is not masked.

FWSecureMode.label: FW Secure Mode
FWSecureMode.help_text: If enabled, access blockers in IS and PS are enabled, and FW is read from IMR. Must be enabled for FW authentication flow and execution of authenticated FW.

SecureTouchCameraMask.label: Secure Touch and Camera Mask
SecureTouchCameraMask.help_text: Camera mask bits per CSI port. When SECURE_TOUCH is set each set bit masks a CSI port for secure touch. When SECURE_TOUCH is cleared this register has no impact on the CSI ports.

IdlmFile.label: IDLM Binary
IdlmFile.help_text: This allows an IDLM binary to be merged into output image built by Intel (R) FIT

DelayedAuthMode.label: Delayed Authentication Mode Enabled
DelayedAuthMode.help_text: This setting enables Delayed Authentication Mode on the platform.

IntelTrcHubBinary.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Binary
IntelTrcHubBinary.help_text: This loads the Intel(R) Trace Hub binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

RomTraceEmergencyModeEn.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Emergency Mode Enabled
RomTraceEmergencyModeEn.help_text: When enabled, Intel(R) ME programs Intel(R) Trace Hub to send debug traces over DCI OOB without target configuration from the Intel(R) System Studio tool. Note: This is intended for debug purposes only and should not be used in "the" shipping configuration.

RomTraceFiltering.label: Intel(R) Trace Hub Filtering
RomTraceFiltering.help_text: This setting allows a user input binary for filtering of output messages for Intel(R) Trace Hub

PmcDbgMsgsEnable.label: PMC Hub Debug Messages Enabled
PmcDbgMsgsEnable.help_text: This setting enables PMC FW trace messages to Intel(R) Trace Hub - When set to Yes, enables trace messages.

UnlockToken.label: Unlock Token
UnlockToken.help_text: This allows the OEM to input an Unlock Token binary file for closed chassis debug.

DbgOverridePreProdSi.label: Debug Override Pre-Production Silicon
DbgOverridePreProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with pre-production platform debugging. This control has no effect if used on production silicon. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details).

DbgOverrideProdSi.label: Debug Override Production Silicon
DbgOverrideProdSi.help_text: Allows the OEM to control FW features to assist with production platform debugging. Note: Certain options will do not work when the descriptor is locked (See FW Bring-up Guide for setting details).

MeRstBehavior.value_list: Intel(R) ME Alternate image boot,,Intel(R) ME will Halt
MeRstBehavior.label: Intel(R) ME Reset Behavior
MeRstBehavior.help_text: This setting determines Intel(R) ME behavior when boot image errors are encountered. Warning: This setting should be used for debug purposes only.

MERstCapCLRst1Enabled.label: Enable Intel(R) ME Reset Capture on CLR_RST#
MERstCapCLRst1Enabled.help_text: This setting configures Intel(R) ME behavior when it resets during CL_RST#1. Note: The recommended default for this setting is 'No'

MERomBypassEnable.label: Firmware ROM Bypass
MERomBypassEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables firmware ROM bypass. Note: This setting only has affect when the firmware being used has ROM Bypass code present.

AfsIdleReclaim.label: AFS Idle Flash Reclaim Enabled
AfsIdleReclaim.help_text: This controls enabling / disabling of Intel(R) ME AFS Idle flash reclaim capabilities. Note: This setting should be used for debug purposes only.

DciDbcEnable.label: Intel(R) DCI DbC Interface Enabled
DciDbcEnable.help_text: This setting enables / disables the Intel ®DCI DbC interface. Note: Applies only before End of Manufacture.

Usb1DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port1 Enabled
Usb1DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection. Note: This setting will be grayed out if USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 0 under the Flex I/O tab is set to 'PCIe (or GbE)'

Usb2DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port2 Enabled
Usb2DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection. Note: This setting will be grayed out if USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 1 under the Flex I/O tab is set to 'PCIe (or GbE)'

Usb3DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port3 Enabled
Usb3DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection. Note: This setting will be grayed out if USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 2 under the Flex I/O tab is set to 'PCIe (or GbE)'

Usb4DciOobEnable.label: DCI OOB over USB3 Port4 Enabled
Usb4DciOobEnable.help_text: This setting determines if the USB port being enabled for DCI OOB. If disabled it will block DCI OOB connection. Note: This setting will be grayed out if USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 3 under the Flex I/O tab is set to 'PCIe (or GbE)'

EspiEcLowFreqOvrd.label: eSPI / EC Low Frequency Debug Override
EspiEcLowFreqOvrd.help_text: When enabled this setting will divide eSPI clock frequency by 8. Note: This setting should only be used for debugging purposes. Leaving this setting enable will impact eSPI performance.

EarlyUsb2DbcOverType-AConfiguration.label: Early USB2 DBC over Type-A Configuration

EnEarlyUsb2DbcCon.label: Enable early USB2 DbC connection
EnEarlyUsb2DbcCon.help_text: This setting enables a delay during Intel(R) ME FW bring-up to allow USB2 DbC connection to be established.

Usb2DbcPortEn.value_list: USB2 Port 1,,USB2 Port 2,,USB2 Port 3,,USB2 Port 4,,USB2 Port 5,,USB2 Port 6,,USB2 Port 7,,USB2 Port 8,,USB2 Port 9,,USB2 Port 10,,No USB2 Ports
Usb2DbcPortEn.label: USB2 DbC port enable
Usb2DbcPortEn.help_text: This setting dedicates USB2 STD-A port for USB2 DbC exclusively. It blocks functional traffic on this port and USB.DbC traffic on all other ports, including USB Type-C ports. Note: These fields do not apply to USB Type-C ports. Early USB2 DBC over Type-A Configuration

Usb3DbcPortEn.value_list: USB3 Port 1,,USB3 Port 2,,USB3 Port 3,,USB3 Port 4,,USB3 Port 5,,USB3 Port 6,,No USB3 Ports
Usb3DbcPortEn.label: USB Connectors Associated USB3 Port enable
Usb3DbcPortEn.help_text: This setting disables USB3 lanes on STD-A port for USB2.DbC. Note: Default is DISABLED

TrcEnable.label: TRC Enabled
TrcEnable.help_text: When enabled the TRC HIP and TRC Countermeasures are enabled. The purpose of this setting is to allow OEMs to enable TRC for testing prior to close of manufacturing and FPF commit.

TrcEnableFpf.label: TRC Enabled (FPF)
TrcEnableFpf.help_text: When enabled the TRC HIP and TRC Countermeasures are enabled. When manufacture is completed, this value is burned into an FPF.

NumActiveCores.value_list: All Cores Active,,1 Core Active,,2 Cores Active,,3 Cores Active,,4 Cores Active,,5 Cores Active,,6 Cores Active,,7 Cores Active,,8 Cores Active
NumActiveCores.label: Number of Active Cores
NumActiveCores.help_text: This setting controls the number of active processor cores. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only. See BIOS Spec for more details on enabling / disabling processor cores.

HyperThreadingDisable.label: Disable Hyperthreading
HyperThreadingDisable.help_text: This setting control enabling / disabling of Hyper threading. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only. See BIOS Spec for more details on enabling / disabling Hyper threading

BistInit.label: BIST Initialization
BistInit.help_text: This setting determines if BIST will be run at platform reset after BIOS requested actions. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only.

FlexRatio.label: Flex Ratio
FlexRatio.help_text: This setting controls the maximum processor non-turbo ratio. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only. See BIOS Spec for more details on maximum processor non-turbo ratio configuration.

JtagPwrDisable.value: No JTAG Power on C10 and Lower
JtagPwrDisable.value_list: No JTAG Power on C10 and Lower,,JTAG Power on C10 and Lower
JtagPwrDisable.label: JTAG Power Disable
JtagPwrDisable.help_text: This setting determines if JTAG power will be maintained on C10 or lower power states. Note: This strap is intended for debugging purposed only.

SvidPresence.value_list: SVID is present,,SVID is not present
SvidPresence.label: SVID Presence
SvidPresence.help_text: This setting determine if SVID rails are present on the platform. See Processor EDS for details.

PlatformImonDisable.label: Platform IMON
PlatformImonDisable.help_text: This strap should be left at the recommended default setting.

VccAuxPresent.label: VCC Aux Present
VccAuxPresent.help_text: This setting determines if VCC Aux exists as a separate VR.

VccInSvidVrAddr.label: VCC IN SVID VR Address
VccInSvidVrAddr.help_text: This setting determines the VCC IN SVID VR Address for the platform.

VccInSvidVrType.label: VCC IN SVID VR Type
VccInSvidVrType.help_text: This setting determines the VCC IN SVID VR Type. See Processor EDS for details.

VssStPgPresent.label: VCC ST PG Present
VssStPgPresent.help_text: This setting determines if VCC ST PG is present on the platform.

VssStgPgPresent.label: VCC STG PG Present
VssStgPgPresent.help_text: This setting determines if VCC STG PG is present on the platform.

CpuBootHangRecEn.label: CPU Boot Hang Recovery Enabled
CpuBootHangRecEn.help_text: By default, this setting is enabled and will allow PMC to recover from CPU boot hangs through either Global reset or SLP_SUS# assertion (based on 'VccST_PG_Exist' CPU soft-strap).. Note: This setting should be set to "No" if the platform configurations employs EC or other mechanism to recover from CPU hangs.

VccinAuxLevelLp.label: VCCIN Aux Level LP
VccinAuxLevelLp.help_text: This setting determines the VCCIN Aux Level LP voltage. Note: Y based MCPs this setting can be configured to 1.65v. On all MCP types set to 1.8v.

PCIeCtrl1LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 1 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl1LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 1 to be reversed. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeCtrl2LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 2 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl2LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 2 to be reversed. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeCtrl3LnReversal.label: PCIe Controller 3 Lane Reversal Enabled
PCIeCtrl3LnReversal.help_text: This setting allows the PCIe lanes on Controller 3 to be reversed. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeContoller1Config.label: PCIe Controller 1 (Port 1-4)
PCIeContoller1Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 1. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeContoller2Config.label: PCIe Controller 2 (Port 5-8)
PCIeContoller2Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 2. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

PCIeContoller3Config.label: PCIe Controller 3 (Port 9-12)
PCIeContoller3Config.help_text: This setting controls PCIe Port configurations for PCIe Controller 3. For further details see Canonlake H / LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIeComboPort0.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 0
SataPCIeComboPort0.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 11 or SATA Port 0. For further details on Flex I/O see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

SataPCIeComboPort1.label: SATA / PCIe Combo Port 1
SataPCIeComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 12 or SATA Port 1. For further details on Flex I/O see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS.

USB3PCIeComboPort0.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 0
USB3PCIeComboPort0.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 1 or USB3 Port 1. For further details on Flex I/O see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting will be grayed out if DCI BSSB over USB3 Port1 Enabled is set to 'yes

USB3PCIeComboPort1.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 1
USB3PCIeComboPort1.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 2 or USB3 Port 2. For further details on Flex I/O see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting will be grayed out if DCI BSSB over USB3 Port2 Enabled is set to 'yes

USB3PCIeComboPort2.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 2
USB3PCIeComboPort2.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 3 or USB3 Port 3. For further details on Flex I/O see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting will be grayed out if DCI BSSB over USB3 Port3 Enabled is set to 'yes'.

USB3PCIeComboPort3.label: USB3 / PCIe Combo Port 3
USB3PCIeComboPort3.help_text: This setting configures the PCIe port to operate as either PCIe Port 4 or USB3 Port 4. For further details on Flex I/O see Tigerlake LP Platform Controller Hub EDS. Note: This setting will be grayed out if DCI BSSB over USB3 Port4 Enabled is set to 'yes'.

USB3Prt1ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB3Prt1ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 1 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt1ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB 3.0 / 3.1 Port 1.

USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 2 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt2ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB 3.0 / 3.1 Port 2.

USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 3 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt3ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB 3.0 / 3.1 Port 3.

USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.value_list: Type C,,Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.label: USB3 Port 4 Connector Type Select
USB3Prt4ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB 3.0 / 3.1 Port 4.

USB3Port1IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port1IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 1 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port1IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 1 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also preform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port2IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port2IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 2 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port2IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 2 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also preform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port3IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port3IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 3 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port3IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 3 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also preform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port4IntSpdSel.value_list: USB3.1 Gen1 LBPM,,USB3.1 Gen2 Skip LBPM
USB3Port4IntSpdSel.label: USB3 Port 4 Initialization Speed Select
USB3Port4IntSpdSel.help_text: This setting determines USB3 Port 4 speed during platform power-up. Note: When configured to USB 3.1 Gen1 the port will also preform carry on LBPM if USB 3.1 is Gen2 enabled.

USB3Port1SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 1 Speed Capability
USB3Port1SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 1 speed capabilities.

USB3Port2SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 2 Speed Capability
USB3Port2SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 2 speed capabilities.

USB3Port3SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 3 Speed Capability
USB3Port3SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 3 speed capabilities.

USB3Port4SpdCap.label: USB3 Port 4 Speed Capability
USB3Port4SpdCap.help_text: This setting determines the USB3 Port 4 speed capabilities.

UsbTypeAbModeSel.value_list: USB Type AB SW Select,,USB Type AB HW Select
UsbTypeAbModeSel.label: USB Type AB Mode Select
UsbTypeAbModeSel.help_text: This setting determines how the USB Type AB connector switching is handled.

USB2Prt1ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt1ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 1 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt1ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 1.

USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 2 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt2ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 2.

USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 3 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt3ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 3.

USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 4 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt4ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 4.

USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 5 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt5ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 5.

USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 6 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt6ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 6.

USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 7 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt7ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 7.

USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 8 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt8ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 8.

USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 9 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt9ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 9.

USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.value_list: Type A / Type C,,Express Card / M.2 S2
USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.label: USB2 Port 10 Connector Type Select
USB2Prt10ConTypeSel.help_text: This setting configures the physical connector type to be used for USB2 Port 10.

IomBinaryFile.label: IO Manageability Engine Binary File
IomBinaryFile.help_text: This loads the Type-C Subsystem IO Manageability Engine binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

IomLength.label: IO Manageability Engine Length
IomLength.help_text: Set the length of IOM sub partition.

IomOemConfigDataFile.label: IO Manageability Engine OEM configuration Binary File
IomOemConfigDataFile.help_text: This loads the Type-C Subsystem IO Manageability Engine OEM Configuration binary that will be written to the OEM config data section.

PhyBinaryFile.label: PHY Binary File
PhyBinaryFile.help_text: This loads the Type-C Subsystem PHY binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

PhyLength.label: PHY Length
PhyLength.help_text: Set the length of MG PHY sub partition.

TbtBinaryFile.label: Thunderbolt(TM)/USB4(TM) Binary File
TbtBinaryFile.help_text: This loads the Type-C Subsystem Thunderbolt(TM)/USB4(TM) binary that will be merged into the output image generated by the Intel(R) FIT tool.

TbtLength.label: Thunderbolt(TM)/USB4(TM) Binary file Length
TbtLength.help_text: Set the length of Thunderbolt(TM) sub partition.

TcssPartialUpdateEn.label: Tcss - Partial Update Enabled
TcssPartialUpdateEn.help_text: This setting enables partial update for TCSS partitions

TcssPortEnMask.label: Type-C Subsystem Port Enable Mask
TcssPortEnMask.help_text: This setting determines the Type-C Subsystem Port Enable Mask.

TypeCPort1Config.label: Type-C Port 1 Configuration
TypeCPort1Config.help_text: This setting determines the configuration of Type-C Port 1.

TypeCPort2Config.label: Type-C Port 2 Configuration
TypeCPort2Config.help_text: This setting determines the configuration of Type-C Port 2.

TypeCPort3Config.label: Type-C Port 3 Configuration
TypeCPort3Config.help_text: This setting determines the configuration of Type-C Port 3.

TypeCPort4Config.label: Type-C Port 4 Configuration
TypeCPort4Config.help_text: This setting determines the configuration of Type-C Port 4.

TypecPort1SpdCap.label: Type-C Port 1 Speed Capability
